definitions: building or complex where monks live together in religious community and devotion
examples: The ancient monastery stood peacefully on the mountainside
Visitors must observe silence inside the monastery walls

definitions: person who lives in a monastery following religious vows and communal rules
examples: The monastic rose early for morning prayers each day
Several monastics worked together in the herb garden

definitions: process of converting something into a source of income or generating revenue from assets
examples: The website's monetization strategy included advertising and subscriptions
Content creators struggle with monetization of their creative work

definitions: person who sells or deals in specific goods or commodities
person who promotes or spreads something undesirable like rumors or fear
examples: The fish monger displayed fresh catches at the market
Local cheese mongers offered samples to passing customers
The fear monger spread panic through false information
War mongers pushed for military action despite diplomatic options

definitions: small agile mammal known for killing snakes and found mainly in Africa and Asia
examples: The mongoose quickly defeated the cobra in their encounter
Wild mongooses help control rodent populations in agricultural areas

definitions: dog of mixed or uncertain breed rather than purebred lineage
examples: The friendly mongrel wagged its tail at every passerby
Many mongrels make excellent family pets despite lacking pedigrees

definitions: informal name or nickname by which someone or something is known
examples: The boxer earned the moniker 'Lightning' for his quick reflexes
The city's moniker as 'Big Apple' originated in jazz circles

definitions: continuous observation and checking of progress, quality, or condition over time
examples: Security monitoring operates twenty-four hours every single day
Patient monitoring revealed improvement in vital signs overnight

definitions: man who belongs to religious order living in community under vows
examples: The monk spent hours in silent meditation each morning
Buddhist monks walked slowly through the village collecting alms

definitions: viral infection causing fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes, common in teenagers
examples: She missed several weeks of school due to mono
The doctor confirmed mono through blood test results yesterday

definitions: art or photography using only shades of one color, typically black and white
examples: The photographer specialized in striking monochrome portrait work
The monochrome display showed text in green on black

definitions: single circular lens worn in one eye, held by facial muscles
examples: The gentleman adjusted his monocle to read the document
Victorian aristocrats often wore monocles as fashion statements

definitions: agricultural practice of growing only one type of crop over large areas
examples: The wheat monoculture stretched for miles across the plains
Environmental scientists warn against monoculture's impact on biodiversity

definitions: practice or state of having only one spouse or partner at a time
examples: Many bird species practice monogamy throughout their breeding season
The couple believed strongly in monogamy and lifelong commitment

definitions: decorative design consisting of overlapped or combined letters, typically someone's initials
examples: The wedding invitations featured an elegant monogram design
She embroidered her monogram on all her handkerchiefs

definitions: detailed written study or essay on single specialized topic or subject by expert
examples: The professor published a monograph on medieval architecture techniques
Her monograph became the definitive work on butterfly migration

definitions: person who speaks or uses only one language in daily life
examples: Many monolingual Americans travel abroad without language preparation
The monolingual child began learning Spanish in kindergarten

definitions: large single upright block of stone, especially shaped into monument
large uniform and impersonal political, corporate, or social structure
examples: The ancient monolith stood mysteriously in the desert
Archaeologists studied inscriptions carved into the stone monolith
The corporation had become a monolith dominating the industry
Critics viewed the government as an unchangeable bureaucratic monolith

definitions: long speech by one person, especially in play or conversation
examples: The actor delivered a powerful monologue about loss and redemption
Her monologue continued for minutes without letting others speak

definitions: exclusive control of supply or trade in commodity or service
popular board game involving property trading and development
examples: The company held a monopoly on telecommunications services nationwide
Government regulations prevented monopoly formation in essential industries
The family played Monopoly every Sunday afternoon together
She always chose the car token when playing Monopoly

definitions: railway system using single rail as track for passenger trains
examples: The monorail glided silently above the city traffic below
Theme park visitors rode the monorail between different sections

definitions: religious belief in existence of only one supreme god or divine being
examples: Judaism introduced monotheism to ancient Middle Eastern cultures
The three major monotheism religions share common historical roots

definitions: continuing sound, especially of speech, without change in pitch or tone
examples: The professor's monotone lecture put several students to sleep
She spoke in a dull monotone throughout the presentation

definitions: quality of wearisome uniformity, lacking in variety, tediously unchanging
examples: The monotony of factory work drove him to seek new employment
She broke the monotony of daily routine with spontaneous adventures

definitions: chemical compound containing one oxygen atom combined with another element
examples: Carbon monoxide from car exhaust poses serious health risks
The detector alarmed when monoxide levels became dangerously high

definitions: seasonal wind bringing heavy rainfall, especially in South Asia during summer months
examples: Farmers eagerly awaited the monsoon rains for their crops
The monsoon brought relief from months of scorching heat

definitions: thing that is outrageously evil, wrong, or extremely ugly in appearance
examples: The abandoned building had become an architectural monstrosity downtown
Critics called the sculpture a monstrosity lacking artistic merit

definitions: technique of combining multiple images or film clips into single composition
examples: The documentary used montage to show decades passing quickly
She created a photo montage celebrating their years together

definitions: orange cartoon cat character known for laziness and love of lasagna
James A. Garfield, twentieth president of United States serving in 1881
examples: Garfield comics appear in newspapers around the world daily
The plush Garfield toy stuck to the car window
President Garfield served only months before his assassination
Garfield advocated for civil service reform during his presidency

definitions: decorative wreath or rope of flowers, leaves, or other materials
examples: Wedding guests hung garlands of roses throughout the reception hall
The holiday garland draped beautifully across the fireplace mantel

definitions: troops stationed in fortress or town to defend it
examples: The garrison prepared defenses against the approaching enemy forces
A small garrison remained to guard the remote outpost

definitions: personal name of Siddhartha Gautama who became known as Buddha
examples: Prince Gautama renounced worldly life seeking spiritual enlightenment
Gautama Buddha's teachings formed the foundation of Buddhism

definitions: knight of King Arthur's Round Table featured in medieval romances
examples: Sir Gawain accepted the Green Knight's dangerous challenge bravely
The tale of Gawain explores themes of honor and courage

definitions: Palestinian territory on eastern Mediterranean coast bordering Israel and Egypt
examples: International aid organizations work to assist Gaza residents daily
The Gaza Strip remains densely populated despite ongoing conflicts

definitions: gigabit, unit of digital information equal to one billion bits
examples: The fiber connection delivers speeds up to 10 Gbit per second
Modern networks transmit data in Gbit quantities routinely

definitions: counter device that detects and measures ionizing radiation levels
examples: The Geiger counter clicked rapidly near the radioactive sample
Scientists used Geiger readings to map contamination levels carefully

definitions: third astrological sign representing twins born May 21 to June 20
NASA human spaceflight program between Mercury and Apollo missions
examples: Her Gemini personality showed in her adaptable, curious nature
The twins celebrated their birthday during Gemini season
Gemini missions tested spacewalking and orbital rendezvous techniques
Project Gemini prepared astronauts for moon landing missions

definitions: Swiss city hosting international organizations including United Nations offices
examples: Diplomats gathered in Geneva for peace negotiation talks
The Geneva Convention established international humanitarian law standards

definitions: person who lives in or comes from Geneva, Switzerland
examples: The Genevan diplomat spoke three languages fluently
Many Genevans work for international organizations headquartered there

definitions: major Italian seaport city in Liguria region on Mediterranean coast
examples: Ships from Genoa traded throughout the Mediterranean for centuries
Christopher Columbus was born in Genoa before his voyages

definitions: person from or relating to Italian city of Genoa
examples: Genoese merchants established trading posts across Europe historically
The Genoese pesto recipe uses local basil and pine nuts

definitions: informal shortened form of gentleman, referring to man
examples: The old gent tipped his hat politely to passersby
Local gents gathered at the pub every Friday evening

definitions: southeastern United States state known for peaches and southern culture
country in Caucasus region between Europe and Asia
examples: Georgia peaches ripen perfectly in the warm southern climate
Atlanta, Georgia hosts major corporations and cultural attractions
The nation of Georgia borders Russia, Turkey, Armenia and Azerbaijan
Georgia gained independence from Soviet Union in 1991

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Georgia state or country
examples: Georgian architecture features elegant symmetrical brick buildings
The Georgian language uses its own unique alphabet system

definitions: relating to branch of Indo-European languages including German, English, Dutch
examples: English evolved from Germanic languages brought by Anglo-Saxon settlers
Germanic tribes migrated across Europe during ancient times
